Instantiate an OoyalaAPIClient

Parameters:
apiKey - the API Key to use for secured APIs
secret - the Secret to use for secured APIs
pcode - the Provider Code
domain - the Embed Domain to use

Method Detail

authorize

public boolean authorize(AuthorizableItem item,
                         PlayerInfo playerInfo)
                  throws OoyalaException
Perform a SAS Authorization on an authorizable item root item is assumed to be a Dynamic Channel and the embed codes are assumed to all be videos. As this method is not asynchronous it should be used within an AsyncTask.

Parameters:
item - the content item to authorize
playerInfo - a PlayerInfo object to determine what can be returned
Returns:
success if authorization was successful (not if the item is authorized)
Throws:
OoyalaException

contentTree

public ContentItem contentTree(List<String> embedCodes)
                        throws OoyalaException
Fetch the root ContentItem associated with the given embed codes. If multiple embed codes are given, the root item is assumed to be a Dynamic Channel and the embed codes are assumed to all be videos. As this method is not asynchronous it should be used within an AsyncTask.

Parameters:
embedCodes - the embed codes to fetch
Returns:
the root ContentItem representing embedCodes
Throws:
OoyalaException

contentTree

public Object contentTree(List<String> embedCodes,
                          com.ooyala.android.ContentTreeCallback callback)
Asynchronously fetch the root ContentItem associated with the given embed codes. If multiple embed codes are given, the root item is assumed to be a Dynamic Channel and the embed codes are assumed to all be videos.

Parameters:
embedCodes - the embed codes to fetch
callback - the ContentTreeCallback to execute when the response is received
Returns:
an Object that can be used to cancel the asynchronous fetch using the cancel(Object task) method

contentTreeWithAdSet

public ContentItem contentTreeWithAdSet(List<String> embedCodes,
                                        String adSetCode)
                                 throws OoyalaException
Fetch the root ContentItem associated with the given embed codes and ad set code. If multiple embed codes are given, the root item is assumed to be a Dynamic Channel and the embed codes are assumed to all be videos. The ad set code specifies which ad set be used. As this method is not asynchronous it should be used within an AsyncTask.

Parameters:
embedCodes - the embed codes to fetch
adSetCode - the ad set code to assign
Returns:
the root ContentItem representing embedCodes
Throws:
OoyalaException

contentTreeWithAdSet

public Object contentTreeWithAdSet(List<String> embedCodes,
                                   String adSetCode,
                                   com.ooyala.android.ContentTreeCallback callback)
Asynchronously fetch the root ContentItem associated with the given embed codes. If multiple embed codes are given, the root item is assumed to be a Dynamic Channel and the embed codes are assumed to all be videos. The ad set code specifies which ad set be used.

Parameters:
embedCodes - the embed codes to fetch
adSetCode - the ad set code to assign
callback - the ContentTreeCallback to execute when the response is received
Returns:
an Object that can be used to cancel the asynchronous fetch using the cancel(Object task) method

contentTreeByExternalIds

public ContentItem contentTreeByExternalIds(List<String> externalIds)
                                     throws OoyalaException
Fetch the root ContentItem associated with the given external ids. If multiple external ids are given, the root item is assumed to be a Dynamic Channel and the external ids are assumed to all be videos. As this method is not asynchronous it should be used within an AsyncTask.

Parameters:
externalIds - the external ids to fetch
Returns:
the root ContentItem representing externalIds
Throws:
OoyalaException

contentTreeByExternalIds

public Object contentTreeByExternalIds(List<String> externalIds,
                                       com.ooyala.android.ContentTreeCallback callback)
Asynchronously fetch the root ContentItem associated with the given external ids. If multiple external ids are given, the root item is assumed to be a Dynamic Channel and the external ids are assumed to all be videos.

Parameters:
externalIds - the external ids to fetch
callback - the ContentTreeCallback to execute when the response is received
Returns:
an Object that can be used to cancel the asynchronous fetch using the cancel(Object task) method

contentTreeNext

public com.ooyala.android.PaginatedItemResponse contentTreeNext(PaginatedParentItem parent)
Fetch additional children for the PaginatedParentItem specified using the nextToken specified. As this method is not asynchronous it should be used within an AsyncTask.

Parameters:
parent - the PaginatedParentItem to fetch additional children for
Returns:
the PaginatedItemResponse

contentTreeNext

public Object contentTreeNext(PaginatedParentItem parent,
                              com.ooyala.android.ContentTreeNextCallback callback)
Asynchronously fetch additional children for the PaginatedParentItem specified using the nextToken specified.

Parameters:
parent - the PaginatedParentItem to fetch additional children for
callback - the ContentTreeNextCallback to execute when the response is received
Returns:
an Object that can be used to cancel the asynchronous fetch using the cancel(Object task) method

objectFromBacklotAPI

public JSONObject objectFromBacklotAPI(String uri,
                                       Map<String,String> params)
Fetch a raw JSONObject from any backlot API (GET requests only). As this method is not asynchronous it should be used within an AsyncTask.

Parameters:
uri - the URI to be fetched from backlot *not* including "/v2". For example, to request https://api.ooyala.com/v2/assets, uri should be "/assets"
params - Optional parameters to pass to the API
Returns:
the raw JSONObject representing the response

objectFromBacklotAPI

public Object objectFromBacklotAPI(String uri,
                                   Map<String,String> params,
                                   com.ooyala.android.ObjectFromBacklotAPICallback callback)
Asynchronously fetch a raw JSONObject from any backlot API (GET requests only)

Parameters:
uri - the URI to be fetched from backlot *not* including "/v2". For example, to request https://api.ooyala.com/v2/assets, uri should be "/assets"
params - Optional parameters to pass to the API
callback - the ObjectFromBacklotAPICallback to execute when the response is received
Returns:
an Object that can be used to cancel the asynchronous fetch using the cancel(Object task) method

cancel

public void cancel(Object task)
Cancel an asynchronous task using the Object returned from the asynchronous method

Parameters:
task - the Object returned from the asynchronous method to cancel

getPcode

public String getPcode()
Returns:
the pcode this OoyalaAPIClient uses
